com.opentok.cloud.controller

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opentok.cloud.controller.Session

  • public class Session
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an OpenTok session.

    Instantiate a Session object by calling the initSession(sessionId) method of the CloudController object.

    Connect to a session by calling the connect() method. Upon a successful connection, the SessionListener.onConnected() method is called. Call the addSessionListener() method to set up an event listener to process this event before calling other methods of the Session object.

    Call the addConnectionListener() method to set up an event listener for connection events (such as when connections are created and destroyed in the session). Call the addStreamListener() method to set up an event listener for stream-related events (such as when streams are created or destroyed in a session).

    Other methods of the Session class let you moderate OpenTok sessions.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Connects to the session. This is an asynchronous call. Before calling other methods of the Session object, make sure that Cloud Raptor has connected to the session. Upon a successful connection, the SessionListener.onSessionConnected() method is called. Call the addSessionListener() method to set up an event listener to determine when you have connected successfully to the session.

        Note that the Cloud Raptor connection shows up as a new connection in all clients connected to the session. The connection data string begins with "CR_" for a Cloud Raptor connection. In Cloud Raptor, look at string returned by the getData() method of the Connection object. In the OpenTok on WebRTC JavaScript library, look at the data property of a Connection object.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects Cloud Raptor from the session.

        Upon a successfuly disconnecting, the SessionListener#onDisconnect() method is called. Call the addSessionListener() method to set up an event listener to process this event.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Whether the Session object is connected to a session.
        See Also:
        connect()

      • signal

        public void signal(java.lang.String type,
          java.lang.String data)
        Sends a signal to everyone in the session. This operation executes synchronously.
        Parameters:
        type - A string identifying the type of signal data. Clients can listen to all signals or to signals of specific types.
        data - The data to send, as a JSON-encoded string.

      • signal

        public void signal(java.lang.String connectionId,
          java.lang.String type,
          java.lang.String data)
        Sends a signal to a specific connection in the session. Specify the connection by passing a connection ID as the connectionId parameter This operation executes synchronously.
        Parameters:
        connectionId - The connection ID of the connection to which the message is sent.
        type - A string identifying the type of signal data. Clients can listen to all signals or to signals of specific types. The type can consist of alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores, and it cannot be an empty string.
        data - The data to send, as a JSON-encoded string.

      • forceDisconnect

        public void forceDisconnect(java.lang.String connectionId)
        Force a specified client to disconnect from the session.
        Parameters:
        connectionId - The connection ID of the connection pertaining to the client to disconnect.

      • forceUnpublish

        public void forceUnpublish(java.lang.String streamId)
        Force a specified stream to stop publishing to the session.
        Parameters:
        streamId - The stream ID of the stream to stop publishing.

      • addConnectionListener

        public void addConnectionListener(ConnectionListener listener)
        Subscribes to connection-related events in this session.
        Parameters:
        listener - The ConnectionListener object, which contains methods for responding to connection-related events in this session.

      • addSignalListener

        public void addSignalListener(java.lang.String type,
                     SignalListener listener)
        Subscribes to signals of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - A string identifying the signal type. The type can consist of alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores, and it cannot be an empty string.
        listener - The event listener that will be notified of a SignalEvent

      • getApiKey

        public java.lang.String getApiKey()
        Returns the API key associated with this session. This is the API key you passed into the CloudController() constructor for the CloudController object you used to call the initSession() method.

      • getSessionId

        public java.lang.String getSessionId()
        Returns the session ID for this session. This is the ID you specified when you instantiated this session object by calling the CloudController.initSession() method.

      • getConnection

        public Connection getConnection()
        Returns the Connection object corresponding to the Cloud Raptor connection to the session. This is only available once you have connected successfully to a session by calling the connect() method and the SessionListener.onSessionConnected() method is called.
